summary: Comprehensive testing of EmergiCAD Pro - Computer-Aided Dispatch system completed. Backend APIs working excellently (14/15 tests passed), frontend interfaces functional with good responsiveness across devices. WebSocket connectivity issues noted but not blocking core functionality.

minor_issues.issue: WebSocket connections failing to establish properly
minor_issues.impact: Real-time updates may not work consistently
minor_issues.details: WebSocket endpoint exists but connections are being closed before establishment. This affects real-time incident and unit status updates.

ui_bugs.issue: Status card not displayed for officers without assigned units
ui_bugs.impact: Officers without unit assignments cannot change status
ui_bugs.details: This is expected behavior - officers need unit assignments to have status controls. Consider adding messaging to explain this to users.

integration_issues.issue: WebSocket connection errors in browser console

design_issues.issue: Layout works well on mobile and tablet
design_issues.details: Dashboard adapts well to different screen sizes, all key elements remain accessible

passed_tests: User authentication (signup/login) for both dispatcher and officer roles
Dispatcher dashboard loading with stats, units, map, and incidents display
Create new incident with comprehensive form validation
Incident grid display with priority indicators and filtering
Unit status board with color-coded statuses
Interactive Leaflet map displaying incidents and units with proper markers
MDT interface for officers with dispatch queue display
CRUD operations for incidents and units
action_item_for_main_agent: Fix WebSocket connection issues - connections are being closed before establishment. This affects real-time updates for incident creation, unit status changes, and dispatch notifications. The WebSocket endpoint exists but needs connection stability improvements.
